description: Add a distinctive, funky pink footer to TaskFlow that breaks from the conventional design system, providing navigation links, branding, and a memorable visual identity with full responsive and dark mode support.

userStories.title: Pink Footer Component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a funky pink footer on every page so that the app has a distinctive brand identity and I can access navigation links from the bottom of the page.
acceptanceCriteria: A Footer component exists at src/components/ui/Footer.tsx using semantic <footer> HTML element
The footer is rendered at the bottom of every page via the root layout (layout.tsx)
The footer uses a bold pink color scheme (gradient from pink-400 to pink-600 or similar) that is visually distinct from the rest of the app
The footer includes at least one funky design element (wave/curved SVG top border, decorative pattern, playful typography, or CSS animation) with SVG decorative elements having aria-hidden='true'
The footer displays the TaskFlow brand name and copyright line (e.g. 'TaskFlow 2026')
The footer includes at least three navigation links (e.g. Home, About, Privacy) styled for legibility against the pink background with visible hover/focus states
On desktop (md+), footer content is laid out horizontally; on mobile (<md), content stacks vertically and is centered
Dark mode support: footer uses a darker/muted pink variant (e.g. dark:bg-pink-900) with legible text in both themes

userStories.title: GitHub Repository Link
userStories.description: As a user, I want a link to the project's GitHub repository in the footer so I can easily find the source code.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer contains a visible link to https://github.com/dlee-mindcurv/ralph-native-with-subagents
Link opens in a new tab (target="_blank" with rel="noopener noreferrer")
Link includes a GitHub icon (SVG) alongside the text
Link is styled consistently with existing footer navigation links
Link is accessible (proper link text, not just an icon)

userStories.title: Animated Gradient Pulse
userStories.description: As a user, I want the footer's pink gradient to gently pulse and shift between color stops so that it feels alive and eye-catching without being distracting.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer background animates between at least 3 pink/fuchsia/rose color stops using a CSS @keyframes animation defined in globals.css
Animation cycle is 6-10 seconds with ease-in-out timing for a smooth, organic feel
Users with prefers-reduced-motion: reduce see a static pink gradient with no animation
The existing wave SVG top border remains visually coherent during the gradient animation
Dark mode uses darker/muted variants of the animated gradient (e.g. pink-900 to fuchsia-900)
Animation uses background-size and background-position techniques (not rapidly swapping classes) for GPU-efficient rendering

userStories.title: Live Task Stats Dashboard
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see live task statistics (total, completed, remaining) in the footer so I can track my productivity at a glance from anywhere on the page.
acceptanceCriteria: A new FooterStats.tsx component exists at src/components/ui/FooterStats.tsx with 'use client' directive
Component consumes useTask() context to read task data
Displays total tasks, completed tasks, and remaining tasks in semi-transparent pill-shaped badges
Shows a friendly empty-state message (e.g. 'No tasks yet â€” add one!') when there are zero tasks
Stats update in real-time as tasks are added, completed, or removed
On mobile (<md), stat pills stack vertically; on desktop (md+), they display horizontally
FooterStats is rendered inside the existing Footer component

userStories.title: Footer Theme Toggle with Sun/Moon Animation
userStories.description: As a user, I want a theme toggle button in the footer with animated sun/moon icons so I can switch between light and dark mode with a delightful visual transition.
acceptanceCriteria: A new FooterThemeToggle.tsx component exists at src/components/ui/FooterThemeToggle.tsx with 'use client' directive
Component consumes useTheme() context to read and toggle the theme
Displays a circular button with an inline SVG sun icon (light mode) or moon icon (dark mode)
Icon transitions with a rotate + scale CSS transition (300-500ms) when toggled
Button has an accessible aria-label that updates based on current theme (e.g. 'Switch to dark mode')
Button is keyboard accessible (focusable, activates on Enter/Space)
FooterThemeToggle is rendered inside the existing Footer component
Button styling is consistent with the footer's pink color scheme

userStories.title: Scroll-to-Top Rocket Button
userStories.description: As a user, I want a rocket-themed scroll-to-top button in the footer so I can quickly navigate back to the top of the page with a fun launch animation.
acceptanceCriteria: A new ScrollToTopRocket.tsx component exists at src/components/ui/ScrollToTopRocket.tsx with 'use client' directive
Displays a button with an inline SVG rocket icon and 'Launch to Top' text
Clicking the button triggers window.scrollTo with smooth scroll behavior to the top of the page
On click, the rocket plays a CSS launch animation (translateY upward + fade out) before resetting
Button is keyboard accessible (focusable, activates on Enter/Space)
Button has an accessible aria-label (e.g. 'Scroll to top')
ScrollToTopRocket is rendered inside the existing Footer component
Button styling is consistent with the footer's pink color scheme

userStories.title: Productivity Mood Indicator
userStories.description: As a user, I want the footer to display a mood emoji and motivational message based on my task completion percentage so I feel encouraged to keep making progress.
acceptanceCriteria: A new FooterMood.tsx component exists at src/components/ui/FooterMood.tsx with 'use client' directive
Component consumes useTask() context to calculate task completion percentage
Maps completion percentage to 6 emoji tiers: 0% sleeping face, 1-20% thinking face, 21-40% slightly smiling, 41-60% grinning, 61-80% star-struck, 81-100% party popper
Each tier displays a unique short motivational message alongside the emoji
Emoji plays a CSS bounce animation when the tier changes
Component uses aria-live='polite' so screen readers announce tier changes
Shows a friendly message when there are no tasks (e.g. 'Add tasks to track your mood!')
FooterMood is rendered inside the existing Footer component

userStories.title: Marquee Ticker with Fun Messages
userStories.description: As a user, I want a scrolling marquee ticker in the footer displaying fun, rotating messages so the footer feels dynamic and entertaining.
acceptanceCriteria: A new FooterMarquee.tsx component exists at src/components/ui/FooterMarquee.tsx
Implements a horizontal scrolling ticker using pure CSS @keyframes animation (no deprecated <marquee> element)
Contains at least 6 fun, light-hearted messages (e.g. productivity tips, jokes, encouragements)
Messages are duplicated in the DOM to create a seamless infinite loop effect
Animation cycle is 20-30 seconds for comfortable reading speed
Users with prefers-reduced-motion: reduce see a single static message instead of scrolling
Text is styled in italic with semi-transparent opacity for a subtle, non-distracting look
FooterMarquee is rendered inside the existing Footer component

userStories.title: Sparkle Trail Hover Effect
userStories.description: As a user, I want sparkle particles to trail my cursor when I hover over the footer so it creates a magical, playful interaction.
acceptanceCriteria: A new FooterSparkles.tsx component exists at src/components/ui/FooterSparkles.tsx with 'use client' directive
On mouse move over the footer area, sparkle elements are spawned at the cursor position
Each sparkle has a randomized fade-out and drift animation (CSS @keyframes) lasting 500-1000ms
Sparkle colors are randomized from a set of pink, white, and fuchsia variants
Maximum of 20 sparkle elements exist in the DOM at any time (oldest removed first)
Sparkle effect is disabled when prefers-reduced-motion: reduce is active
Sparkles are purely decorative and do not interfere with clicking footer links or buttons
FooterSparkles is rendered as an overlay inside the existing Footer component

userStories.title: Konami Code Easter Egg
userStories.description: As a user, I want to trigger a confetti celebration by entering the Konami code so there's a hidden surprise that rewards curious users.
acceptanceCriteria: A new KonamiEasterEgg.tsx component exists at src/components/ui/KonamiEasterEgg.tsx with 'use client' directive
Listens for the Konami code sequence (Up Up Down Down Left Right Left Right B A) via document keydown events
On successful sequence entry, triggers a confetti burst of 30+ pieces originating from the footer area
Confetti pieces have randomized colors, sizes, rotation angles, and trajectories using CSS @keyframes animations
A secret congratulatory message (e.g. 'You found the secret! You are a TaskFlow legend!') appears for 3 seconds then fades out
The keydown event listener is properly cleaned up in useEffect return function
KonamiEasterEgg is rendered inside the existing Footer component
Easter egg can be triggered multiple times
